articles.headline: Jake Tonges clutch for Niners, who await George Kittle's MRI
articles.description: While the Niners await word on the severity of George Kittle's hamstring injury, it was his backup, Jake Tonges, who filled in admirably, scoring the go-ahead TD -- his first -- against the Seahawks.

images.name: Tonges [600x600]
images.caption: Jake Tonges delivers an emphatic spike of the football after scoring what he later said was the first game-winning touchdown of his career.

articles.headline: Ravens vs. Bills: Live updates from Lamar Jackson, Josh Allen's Week 1 matchup
articles.description: Follow along for real-time highlights, analysis and key moments as Josh Allen and the Bills host Lamar Jackson and the Ravens.

articles.headline: Betting buzz: Sunday under-whelming for sportsbooks, bettors
articles.description: The Jets-Steelers game was the exception in the NFL on Sunday when almost every game went under the point total.

images.name: Justin Fields [1296x729]
images.caption: Heading into "Sunday Night Football," the Jets-Steelers game was the only NFL game to go over the point total on Sunday.
images.alt: New York Jets quarterback Justin Fields (7) throws the ball during the second half against the Pittsburgh Steelers at MetLife Stadium.

images.name: Micah Parsons of Green Bay Packers [608x342]
images.caption: Micah Parsons is now the Defensive Player of the Year favorite, and his new team is the top choice in the NFC North.

images.name: Arch Manning of Texas Longhorns [608x342]
images.caption: Arch Manning's Heisman odds took a major tumble after Texas' loss to Ohio State.

images.name: Burrow and Jackson for Betting Buzz (250813) [1296x729]
images.caption: Ravens QB Lamar Jackson finished second in NFL MVP voting last season, while Bengals QB Joe Burrow finished fourth.
images.alt: Joe Burrow #9 of the Cincinnati Bengals and Lamar Jackson #8 of the Baltimore Ravens embrace after the game at Paycor Stadium on September 17, 2023 in Cincinnati, Ohio

articles.headline: Micah Parsons quickly makes impact in his Packers debut
articles.description: Less than two weeks after being traded to Green Bay, Micah Parson got his first sack and was second on the team with three pressures during Sunday's win vs. Detroit.

images.name: 250907 Parsons [1296x729]
images.caption: Micah Parsons reached a top speed of 18.47 mph when he chased down Lions QB Jared Goff, according to NFL Next Gen Stats. That was his fastest max speed on any of his 53.5 career sacks.
images.credit: Tork Mason-USA TODAY Network via Imagn Images

articles.headline: Tennessee Titans fall to Denver Broncos in Cam Ward's debut
articles.description: The NFL regular-season debut for No. 1 pick Cam Ward, who completed 12 of 28 passes for 112 yards, had its share of rough moments as the Tennessee Titans lost a 20-12 decision to the Denver Broncos on Sunday at Empower Field at Mile High.

articles.headline: Lions falter in opener; Campbell calls issues 'correctable'
articles.description: The Lions' offense had its worst day since 2023, something coach Dan Campbell blamed on not being clean enough, but he says it is correctable.
